title: Getting Started with Next.js
content:
**\

Why Do Exes Come Back When You Least Expect It?**  File Name: do-exes-come-back Alt Text: A man handing flowers to his girlfriend. Caption: Why do exes come back when all you want is to move forward? Is it because they still love you? *Why do exes come back when you are well on your way to healing?* Exes always appear in your highs and drag you down a rabbit hole of emotions. When this happens, it can be confusing and frustrating, and a resounding question of *“Why now?"* plagues your mind. There are numerous reasons why exes do this, but here are the most common ones. **\

1. They Still Love You** Your ex might have broken up with you in the heat of the moment, even if they intensely loved you. That's because, sometimes, emotions other than love can make one say and do things they didn't intend to, and in turn, cause separation. However, a few weeks or months after the breakup, they might have realized they were wrong, making them try to take back their rash decision. **\

2. They Are Different Now and Want to Try Again** Most breakups are because of something lacking in the relationship, whether in communication, trust, or intimacy. Some exes realize the mistake they made in the relationship long after the breakup and decide to turn over a new leaf. And now that they’re in the best place possible, they want to win you back. **\

3. They Come Back Out of Jealousy** They might have grasped the news that you’re seeing someone new. But instead of being happy for you, they feel like they are losing something that belonged to them. While you might think this jealousy is because they still love you, you’re wrong. They might come back into your life to cause chaos. Their random text asking about your day might not be as innocent or friendly as you perceive it to be. It can be a way to manipulate you and sabotage your current relationship. You see, some exes have no intentions to reconcile. They just don’t want anyone else to be with you. They want you to be alone, just like them. **\

4. They Got Tired of Being Single** At first, they felt stifled in the relationship and imagined being single was the solution. They thought it would be an endless night out with their friends, non-stop fun, and plenty of romantic options to explore.  However, when they discovered that the grass isn't greener on the other side, they came crawling back into the comfort your relationship brought.  **\

5. They Want an Ego Boost** In connection to the previous point, there’s a good chance that your ex’s main reason for returning is to feel better about themselves. They want your attention and to know that you still like them, boosting their ego.  **\**[**Some people are innately selfish**](https://poltavawomen.com/dating/relationship-advice-deal-with-disagreements.html)**\**, and your ex might be one of them. Do exes come back because they want you to be happy? Most likely not. They’re probably thinking more about their needs than yours at the moment.   **\

What Should I Do When They Come Back?** You need to hold out for someone who deserves you. Don’t allow your ex to reenter your world and steal back your heart if they don’t deserve it. Even if you can get back together, that doesn’t mean you should. Sometimes, leaving the past in the past is the best thing you can do for yourself. Remember that you broke up for a reason. Even if time has passed, that doesn’t always mean things have changed. If you get back together, history could repeat itself. That’s why you need to be careful and ask yourself, *"Why do exes come back?"*  Listen to your heart, but don’t ignore what your head is telling you.
author: John Does

title: Understanding NextAuth for Authentication
content: NextAuth.js makes it easy to implement authentication in your Next.js applications.
author: testwet

title: Deploying a Next.js
content: Vercel provides an easy way to deploy your Next.js applications with minimal configuration.
author: Alex John

title: Is Your Girlfriend Wife Material?
content:
**\

** **Is Your Girlfriend Wife Material?** **File Name:** wife-material **Alt Text:** A man hugging his wife outdoors **Caption:** Think carefully on whether your girl is truly wife material or not Questions come hand in hand with each new stage of a relationship. The first one is usually “What are we?” for those who have yet to put a label on things. Along the way, more questions come up, although they may differ from couple to couple. “Is it time to move in together?” or “Should we get a pet?” are prime examples. Yet, there’s one question every man should ask before asking *the* question. It’s a simple, innocuous question that should never be avoided if a happy, prosperous life with your partner happens to be your goal. *Is my girlfriend wife material?* Some may think they don’t need to ask themselves this. After all, if the relationship has reached a level of seriousness to consider marriage as a viable option, then the woman in question *should* already have the necessary qualities of a wife. While that’s ideally true, it isn’t always the case. With something as important as deciding on a spouse, it pays to err on the side of caution. So, here are some qualities every woman should have before you can say with certainty that she has what it takes to be a wife: **\

When Her Love is Unwavering and Mature** First thing’s first, we have to broach the topic of love. Having someone by your side through thick and thin is one of the foundations of a good marriage. When a woman loves you on good days and bad, and does not have extended periods where she’s [emotionally unavailable](https://costa-rica-women.com/psychology/spot-dating-red-flags-women.html), then you’ve got unwavering right there. As for a mature love, that means she loves you for you and not because of anything arbitrary. This kind of love also means that she’ll push you when you need pushing, call you out when you need calling out, all because of how much she cares. No buts or ifs about it. **\

When Her Resilience and Overall Capabilities are Top Tier** Life can be quick to knock us down. A wife is more than just someone who loves you; she’s someone you can rely on for when things get tough (and vice versa, of course). A woman who can handle setbacks like a champ is going to help make things easier if you marry her. Beyond resilience, the topic of marriage also implies maturity and capability. Both partners should be able to learn and develop skills so that their marriage will not just survive, but thrive. If a woman has high communication skills, financial management skills, among others, then you know you’ve got a keeper. **\

When Her Trustworthiness Is Beyond Reproach** As the saying goes, without trust there is no love. So, that means you can’t make a woman a wife if you have any reason not to trust her. You may love each other and you may be mature individuals who are ready for anything, but mistrust is like a cancer that grows and spreads. While trust is important for any relationship, it is doubly so as far as marriage is concerned. It can be given freely or it can be earned, but those women who prove themselves to be absolutely trustworthy time and time again can proudly say that they are, in fact, wife material. Regardless of where you found the woman of your dreams, be it through a serendipitous manner or through an active search for [love abroad](https://costa-rica-women.com/success_stories/single-mans-costa-rica-travel-experience.html), it pays to find out if she embodies any of the qualities listed above. If so, then all that’s left is to pop *the* question so that you can look forward to the rest of your life with her.
description: Before you pop the question that will shape the rest of your life, there’s another important thing to ask yourself: is your girlfriend wife material?

title: Healing After Cheating: Are You On the Way to Recovery?
content:
Healing After Cheating: Are You On the Way to Recovery?

 

 

You’ve endured it all—the betrayal, anger, and brokenness. You’ve contemplated giving up time and again. But no matter what you do, you can’t deny that glimmer of hope telling you to give your partner another chance.

 

And here you are now, with your partner, who has broken your trust in the past but promises to change and make it up to you.

Together, you work on rebuilding your relationship after the storm. Although you’ve committed yourselves to going through healing after cheating, the long journey fills you with doubts and discouragement.

Are you making the right decision? Will things get better in time? What if they cheat again?

Facing uncertainty is not easy at all. You will only know the answers as you go down the road.

However, the following indications show you’re already attaining positive developments in your healing process and are on the right path.

 

1. Commitment to Healing

 

The main factor in the healing process is commitment to it. Without it, there’s no point in trying to maintain your relationship.

However, both of you must commit. Even though you might not be guilty of infidelity, rebuilding a relationship takes two.

Own your respective responsibilities to fix the problem and be open to forgiveness. Cooperate in setting healthy boundaries, follow through with agreements, and be vulnerable to your partner.

Change will take time, and there will be hurdles along the way. But when you have mutual commitment, you’ve won half the battle.

 

2. Couples Therapy

 

An indispensable part of healing after cheating is going through therapy together. Seeking professional help shows your sincerity in turning a new leaf and improving your relationship. Your efforts will also be more effective when an expert is guiding you.

However, therapy can be intense and lengthy, so be patient and supportive of each other. Pay attention to each other’s needs and fears. When the going gets tough, find encouragement in knowing you’re not alone in this journey.

 

3. Renewed Connection

 

Cheating is a violation of trust and breaks your bond. No matter how close you and your partner were beforehand, infidelity finds a way to estrange you from each other.

And when that happens, it will take time and effort to rekindle the spark. However, your common desire to fix your relationship will be valuable in bringing you back together.

When you spend time with each other, reach out in times of need, or share about your day, you build your intimacy. Slowly, you renew your connection, paving the way for healing.

 

4. Willingness to Grow

 

Healing after cheating doesn’t mean going back to how your relationship used to be before the affair. You can never go back in time; you can only move forward. What matters now is that you’re both willing to learn from the trial and grow as a couple.

Accept that the cheating incident is now part of your love story. Take it as a time to rediscover yourself, strengthen your relationship, and learn to love more deeply. In time, you’ll see a new love blossom from this wound. It will be sweeter the second time around.

 

Healing is a Journey Together

 

Committing yourself to the recovery process after your partner’s affair is a courageous act. It’s not easy to rebuild a devastated relationship, let alone forgive. 

However, when you sincerely make an effort, you’ll eventually see signs of renewal and healing. These can tell you that you’re on the right track. 

Let these signs be your encouragement as you journey together through the thick and thin of the healing process.
author: afacebu.abraham@gmail.com
description: Cheating causes so much damage that you don't know if things will ever get better. But rest assured, you’re healing after cheating when you see these signs.
keywords: healing after cheating, rebuilding a relationship
caption: Are you doing it right? Check these signs to see if you’re on the right track to healing after cheating.

title: Live, Love, Laugh: The Significance of Love Language
content:
Live, Love, Laugh: The Significance of Love Language

 

 

Are you aware of what your love language is?

What about your partner’s or any other loved one? If the answer to those questions is a resounding no, then you’ve come to the right place. Given today’s modern world, and the varied approaches to love and relationships, it pays to know what love languages are and why they are important.

 

What Is a Love Language?

 

Going by its most basic definition, love languages are the specific ways individuals are most likely to express affection. This also works the other way around, with love languages also defining how individuals prefer to receive affections in turn. 

 

The concept as a whole originated in Dr. Gary Chapman’s 1992 book, aptly titled The 5 Love Languages. Since then, its popularity has grown to the point of it practically being a household term. Although this is often spoken of in the context of romantic partnerships, those who are single can also apply love languages to other loved ones, such as friends and family members.

 

What are the Five Love Languages?

 

Dr. Gary Chapman’s book detailed five specific love languages: physical touch, words of affirmation, quality time, acts of service, and gifts (both giving and receiving). It was the same book that claimed that every person has at least one of the aforementioned five as a primary love language.

 

To explore each one in detail:

Physical touch - centered around hugs, kisses, and other physical gestures.

Words of affirmation - refers to compliments, encouragement, kind words, and other verbal expressions of affection.

Quality time - the devotion of one's time to being with loved ones.

Acts of service - the effort in performing tasks for loved ones.

Gifts - the giving and receiving of gifts are acts that are also tied with the concept of love languages.

 

The Benefits of Learning About Love Languages

It must be said that love languages lead to self-awareness. The better you know yourself, the more potential you have for growth as a partner, a loved one, and as a person overall. You would then be better equipped to leave your comfort zone behind in the name of self-improvement.

Speaking of self-improvement and growth, knowing your love language and the love language of your loved ones can also encourage empathy and selflessness. Your relationships will improve because not only are you better aware of what you want, but you will also know how to please your loved ones better.

 

With that said, love languages can clearly help develop and maintain intimacy. You and your partner will be able to connect with one another in easier and deeper ways. With greater satisfaction in your relationships as a whole, everybody involved wins.

 

The role that one’s love language plays in our day-to-day lives cannot be understated. Especially if the benefits outlined above are any indication. The more we know, the better chances we have of vastly improving our most intimate relationships. With that said, it can still be tricky putting love languages to effective use, so be sure to proceed with caution.
author: afacebu.abraham@gmail.com
description: Everybody has a love language, and whether we’re aware or not, it plays a significant role in how we bond in relationships.
keywords: love language, physical touch, words of affirmation, quality time, acts of service
altText: A heart drawn into the clear, smooth sands of a beach
caption: A love language is exactly what is sounds like: how we express love

title: Is Compatibility a Requirement for a Happy Relationship?
content:
Is Compatibility a Requirement for a Happy Relationship?

Unfortunately for everyone who has ever tried looking for it, there is no hidden treasure map or secret formula that can guarantee true love.

What’s available is a constantly evolving list of factors that people can aim for to get their best approximation of it — and that list involves a curious thing called compatibility.

Cut From the Same Cloth

When two people have the same sense of humor, there’s a good chance they’re compatible.

When they find in each other what they consider to be interesting or attractive, odds are that they, too, have high compatibility.

The same goes for pairs who share values, dreams, and outlook on life. It’s when someone brings to the table pieces of themselves that seem to fit with the pieces inside of you that you become a great, if not perfect, match.

And something like that makes for a good relationship indeed.

But is it really necessary?

Compatibility as a Process

According to British author Alain de Botton, compatibility is an achievement of love and not its precondition.

Meaning, it’s something that couples can attain over the course of their relationship.

So when treated as a qualification at the start instead of something that can develop over time, compatibility can therefore be the reason a person lets go of or turns down someone who would’ve been perfectly good for them if given half the chance.

Because of this misconception, people can have unrealistic expectations of first dates.

They can have impossible criteria for what makes someone a good potential lover. One wrong answer to an innocent question or a disagreement over a simple thing can convince people that they’re not meant for each other after all. 

People can end up assuming that compatibility is something that someone finds in its perfect form, not one that is built with time, patience, and commitment.

Conditions for a Partnership

There’s a handful of things that countless people and years of history can attest to be what’s needed for a happy and loving relationship.

Trust. Respect. Understanding. Intimacy.

Different people would add a few more, but what most would agree on is that each is a pillar that makes true love achievable.

Compatibility plays a similar role.

It creates a suitable venue for a happy relationship to thrive. With it, two people are able to be on the same page and meet each other halfway.

When couples are compatible, it’s easier for them to communicate and get to know each other better. Fewer things are lost in translation, and there is a common ground that they can depend on.

With compatibility comes the alignment of all the important things in a relationship: goals and expectations, to name a few. When you and your partner want the same things, it’s easier to work together.

Road to True Love

Even though no one can say for sure how to find or achieve true love, many people still try.

And for most of them, a compatibility test turns out to be a vital process.

But instead of something that needs to be fulfilled before two people can start the road to a happy and successful relationship, it is more a nebulous thing — both a goal and an obligation.
author: afacebu.abraham@gmail.com
description: Love alone may not be enough. Without compatibility, even loving couples can lose sight of each other and end up with conflicting desires and goals.
altText: A blue jigsaw puzzle piece with a yellow heart
caption: It’s great to have compatibility with your partner so you are on the same page about important values, goals, and expectations.

title: Giving Gifts as Love Language: The Gift That Keeps on Giving
content:
Giving Gifts as Love Language: The Gift That Keeps on Giving

One day, your partner comes home with a cute box with a bow. They hand it to you with a genuine smile. 

You say thanks and ask the reason for the sudden gift. Their answer? They just thought of you and wanted to make your day more special.

It sounds sweet, doesn’t it?

Whether it’s a holiday or just a random occasion, a gift is always the perfect thing to bring. There’s nothing more appropriate than a present wrapped in a bow.

With that, what makes giving gifts a special gesture? Is it the act itself? Does the gift’s content matter the most? Does the way you give it also count? 

Gift-Giving as a Love Language

As simple a concept as this love language is, some people still need clarification. 

Gift-giving isn’t about the gift itself or its price tag. If the present is both physical and meaningful, it’ll be enough to make someone happy.

Another thing: people who love giving and receiving gifts aren’t spoiled or spoiling their partners. If anything, they’re simply doting on them and aren’t afraid to splurge a little to make them happy.

The point is that gift-giving doesn’t indicate a person’s materialism. It’s all about the thought, sentimental value, and appreciation attached to it.

 

The Gift of Giving: Why Do We Love Gifts?

Don’t get me wrong; hearing words of affirmation is great! They provide reassurance and boost confidence. But the thing is, physical representations hold just as much weight. 

For one, not only do they make a good keepsake, but they're also a great reminder of someone’s love and appreciation.

Two, they’re a pleasant surprise. Even if the holidays roll around, we can’t predict or expect when we’ll get gifts. And when we receive them, our days just become extra bright.

Lastly, they make you feel seen. For instance, your partner got you something you wanted a few months ago. It shows they’re paying attention, even if it was just a passing detail.

Tips for Giving Gifts in Relationships

There’s an art to gift-giving. Thoughtfulness is the name of the game. Regardless of the occasion, here’s how you can ace this timeless gesture:

1. Step into your partner’s shoes.

Put your thinking cap on. What would your partner buy for themselves? Is this tip obvious? Maybe, but it almost always ends well.

2. Be generous but practical.

Go ahead and find the best gift you can get for a partner. But at the same time, you don’t need to pay a hefty price tag for that. Prices don’t always guarantee satisfaction.

3. Try giving experiences for a change.

Things like plane tickets or gift certificates may not seem like much initially. However, they connect givers and receivers, even if the experience isn’t shared. Such gifts can make people feel that they’re around them vicariously.

No matter what you decide to get for your partner, here’s one last thing to remember: giving gifts should start with your heart. There’s no point if you’re coming from a disingenuous place.
author: afacebu.abraham@gmail.com
description: Giving gifts isn’t just giving your partner something nice and pricey wrapped with a bow. Let’s take a closer look at this love language.
keywords: giving gifts, the gift of giving,giving gifts in relationships
altText: An illustration of a couple giving gifts to each other
caption: Few things feel as good as giving gifts

title: What to Expect When Dating a Single Mom
content:
What to Expect When Dating a Single Mom

Dating a single mom comes with the whole shebang: love, laughs, and tiny hands exploring everything. 

But not everyone’s ready for a full-blown fairy tale family. 

It’s not just about holding hands and stolen kisses; it’s joining a story that’s already in progress—becoming a chapter in a book with lots of chapters before you.

Some single moms rock solo, not because they’re scared or don’t want love, but because they know their little ones are their whole world. 

But for others, finding a partner isn’t about filling a gap; it’s about sharing their amazing adventure with someone who adds to the story, and not take away from it.

It’s a special experience when you date a single mom. It comes with its own set of circumstances and considerations that you won’t encounter in other relationships. 

Here’s what you can expect when dating a single mom.

1. Her Children Will Always Come First

This doesn’t mean you won’t be important to her, but it does mean that her kids’ needs will always take priority. Be prepared for last-minute cancellations or changes in plans due to soccer games, school plays, or bedtime emergencies. 

Flexibility is your new middle name. You have to understand that her schedule revolves around her children’s needs and sometimes unexpected things come up.

 

Instead of competing with her time, think of yourself as part of her tribe, supporting and cheering her on as she juggles her priorities.

 

2. She May Have Limited Free Time

Between work, childcare, and household responsibilities, single moms often have jam-packed schedules. Date nights might be less frequent than you’re used to, and they may need to be creative with how they spend their free time.

You must understand that things will not always be like clockwork. Instead of fancy dinners, cozy nights watching movies or park picnics with the kids might be your new date night routine. 

But hey, cherishing those little moments together can make the time you do have even more special!

3. You Will Likely Meet Her Ex

This can be awkward, but it’s important to remember that he’s still the father of her children and will always be a part of her life. Try to be friendly and respectful, even if you don’t click right away. 

Awkwardness is temporary, understanding is lasting. A genuine smile and a friendly offer to help with the kids can go a long way. You don’t have to become best buds, but mutual respect paves the way for a smoother journey. 

4. You Will Need to Be Patient and Understanding

Single moms have been through a lot, and they may not be ready to jump into a relationship right away. Be patient, give her time to adjust, and don’t pressure her to move faster than she’s comfortable with. 

Remember, true love doesn’t need a deadline. Enjoy the journey, celebrate small wins, and let your love blossom organically. If you gain her trust, she will be worth the wait.

5. You Will Get to Experience the Joys of Motherhood Firsthand

Seeing the bond between a single mom and her child is truly special. You will get to witness the love, laughter, and everyday moments that make up their unique relationship.

You will become part of their inside jokes, the bedtime stories, and the spontaneous adventures fueled by giggles. Every moment, ordinary or extraordinary, is a glimpse into a love that transcends words. 

The Joy of Dating a Single Mom

Dating a single mom isn’t about taking on extra baggage, it’s about joining a beautiful adventure. 

While you might think it’s complicated, remember that they aren’t asking for anything special. They simply crave a partner who gets them, someone who can handle the joys and challenges of their unique world. 

So, if you’re looking for a partner who’s strong, independent, and full of surprises, don’t be afraid to open your heart to a single mom. You might just discover the most rewarding and joyful adventure of your life.

description: Are you ready when it comes to dating a single mom? Get to know the facts about her situation so you’ll better understand each other.
keywords: dating a single mom, single mom

caption: Dating a single mom can be challenging. But if you know how to navigate the relationship, it can also be very fulfilling.
